alert.note: Alert for Adams; Brown; Highland; Pike; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 9:28PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL BROWN, NORTHERN ADAMS, WESTERN PIKE, HIGHLAND AND SOUTHWESTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 1000 PM EDT... At 928 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles southwest of Hillsboro, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Hillsboro, Lynchburg, Marshall, Sardinia, Bainbridge, Pike Lake, Kincaid Springs, Belfast, Rocky Fork Point, Highland Holiday, Cynthiana, Russell, New Market, Emerald, Mowrystown, Sinking Spring, Danville in Highland County, May Hill, Knockemstiff and Berrysville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
